page.title: 11SHOTESHAM/HOWE HOUSING 2
page.content: {PLANNING POLICIES}within "The Norfolk Structure Plan" is for restricted growth. The emphasis for new housing is on infilling, not on estate development. Any new building or structural alteration is controlled by South Norfolk District Council. { {BUILDING MATERIALS}used in construction include Norfolk Red Bricks, Clay Lump and Wattle and Daub. Roofing is generally Red Pantile but there is some Black Pantile, Pintile and Thatch. {BUILDING FEATURES}Whilst the majority of houses are Brick some are Timber Framed and retain leaded windows. There are Dutch and Tumbled Gables and the bonding of the brickwork is either Flemish or English. New buildings are controlled to include traditional features.
